program: Master of Public Health (MPH) – Geisel School of Medicine

sections.text: The Dartmouth MPH trains professionals to lead improvements in population health through rigorous study of policy, epidemiology, and healthcare delivery.

items: Core in biostatistics, epidemiology, health policy, and leadership
Capstone project in healthcare delivery science
sections.text: The program emphasizes applied population health and leadership training through core coursework and capstone research.

items: Background in health, policy, or quantitative fields recommended
sections.text: Applicants must hold a bachelor’s degree and show evidence of academic or professional preparation in health-related or analytical areas.
Graduates assume positions in public health practice, research, policy, and healthcare leadership.
